Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the Jeopardy game.

Each player has a unique ID, a display name, and a score that is always maintained as a non-negative integer.

  • Constructor Summary

    Creates a player with the given ID and name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String playerId, String name)
      Creates a player with the given ID and name. The initial score is set to zero.
      Parameters:
      playerId - unique identifier for the player
      name - display name of the player

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the display name of this player.
      Returns:
      the player's name

    • getPlayerId

      public String getPlayerId()
      Returns the unique identifier of this player.
      Returns:
      the player ID

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns the current score of this player.
      Returns:
      the player's score

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Sets the player's score, as long as the provided value is not negative.

      If a negative value is passed, the score is left unchanged.

      Parameters:
      score - the new score value (must be non-negative)

    • addPoints

      public void addPoints(int points)
      Adds the specified number of points to this player's score.

      Only positive point values are accepted; non-positive values are ignored.

      Parameters:
      points - the number of points to add (must be greater than zero)

    • subtractPoints

      public void subtractPoints(int points)
      Subtracts the specified number of points from this player's score while ensuring that the score never becomes negative.

      Only positive point values are considered; non-positive values are ignored.

      Parameters:
      points - the number of points to subtract (must be greater than zero)

    • resetScore

      public void resetScore()
      Resets the player's score back to zero.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this player, including ID, name, and current score.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing this player

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this player to another object for equality.

      Two players are considered equal if they are of the same class and have the same playerId.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the players have the same ID, otherwise false

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code based on this player's ID.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code for this player
